channel.title: KPIT Digital Thought Leadership Series
channel.description: Exclusive Series by KPIT, published on Forbes India website, on how Digital and Engineering are Transforming the World

item.title: Machine-to-Machine: Manufacturing in a connected world
item.description: In this constantly connected world, businesses are increasingly turning to machine-to-machine communications (M2M) and analytics as clean data is becoming a pre-requisite for companies to optimise productivity

item.title: Smart Transportation: A Key Building Block for a Smart City
item.description: By creating a connected ecosystem wherein people execute their journeys seamlessly, smart transportation can improve the way people use their time and enhance the quality of their lives-in the cities of today and tomorrow.

item.title: The business value of enabling IoT in industrial manufacturing
item.description: As digital disruption paves the way for the entry of agile, tech-driven startups, it is incentivising big, established manufacturing companies to rewire their business models

item.title: Erasing boundaries for a unique customer experience
item.description: The coming together of digital technologies, such as big data, connected assets, cloud, mobility and predictive modelling can create and enable such a boundaryless exchange.

item.title: The role of autonomous driving technology in India
item.description: Fully self-driving cars use the latest technology within an entire spectrum of autonomous technologies, and the latest technology is not always the most appropriate for a society.

item.title: Electric buses: An opportunity to transform public transport in India
item.description: Electric vehicles and buses are a great way to curb India's pollution problem. But what will make Indians ditch their cars and use the public transportation system for maximum effect?

item.title: How smart glasses are transforming backend processes in manufacturing
item.description: Within warehouses, order-picking accounts for an estimated 55 percent of the total warehouse operating expenses. Underperformance in this task negatively affects the cost and performance of a warehouse.

item.title: Automated fuel stations: Enhancing customer experience using analytics at retail points
item.description: From being just a place for a need-based, 'distress purchase' of fuel, automated fuel stations can be the integration point for a range of services.

item.title: Disruptions in the global automotive industry: Solutions from India?
item.description: India's challenges require scale to be a part of the solution so logically, any product designed for India's scale would be in a better position to be adopted by the rest of the world, than the other way around.

item.title: Supply chain optimisation using technology in manufacturing
item.description: Technology-enabled processes are providing manufacturers a bird's eye view of the entire supply line. This comes with its benefits and challenges.

item.title: Smart Cities-India's next tech opportunity to lead the world
item.description: With its talented manpower and IT prowess, India can show the world how mass-scale, flexible and affordable smart city infrastructure can be created and replicated anywhere across the globe.

item.title: Making connected factories a reality in India
item.description: A shift that is aligning with where the manufacturing industry the world over is heading-towards a more interconnected, agile and flexible production process to seemingly fuse man, technology and machine.
